5 Minute Brainstorm: Design Solutions for Water Conservation

Here's how the 5 Minute Brainstorm works. Your teacher will set a timer for 5 minutes. Each student will write down as many design solution ideas as they can in 5 minutes. Each brainstorm has its own textbox (below) that you can drag into your workspace. Each brainstorm also has its own prompt to follow. Today you will complete three 5 Minute Brainstorms.

During the brainstorm, write down as many ideas as you can. Your idea does not have to be based on something that already exists. Push yourself to brainstorm as many ideas as possible. Every idea counts!

Collaborative Sketching

Here's how collaborative sketching works:

1. Sketch one of your design solution ideas. You can choose an idea from the list above or a totally new idea. You should take about 3 minutes to sketch your idea.

2. Explain your sketch to your partner. How does the design solution work? What are it's special features and details?

3. Swap sketches. Add on to your partner's sketch. (1) Sketch some of the special features and details based on your partner's description and (2) add something new to their sketch.

4. Explain the additions you made to your partner. How does the design solution work? What are it's special features and details?
